document.docAuthor: Najajrah, Mohammad H., Swaileh, Khalid M. & Qumsiyeh, Mazin B.
document.masterDocTitle: Systematic list, geographic distribution and ecological significance of lady beetles (Coleoptera: Coccinellidae) from the West Bank (Central Palestine)

Remarks:
Hippodamia variegata
originated in the Palaearctic region. However, because it is considered an efficient aphidophagous lady beetle, it has been spread globally ( Soleimani & Madadi 2015 ). When food is plentiful,
Hippodamia variegata
and
Coccinella septempunctata
do not compete for aphid prey, and they were often found together feeding on the same aphids on the same weeds.
